item.title: 10 Best Labyrinths & Mazes In Pokemon Games, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon dungeons offer a diverse range of challenges and atmospheres for players to explore and conquer.
  • From Turnback Cave's mirrored surfaces to Victory Road's disrepair, each dungeon showcases unique design elements.
  • The dungeons in the Pokemon series not only serve as obstacles for players, but also hold legendary secrets and pivotal moments.

The Pokemon series is renowned by gamers for encouraging a sense of exploration. From wandering through sprawling metropolitan cities and sneaking through the tall grass, players have no shortage of locations to discover. Where Game Freak excels, however, is its creation of maze-like dungeons and labyrinthine challenges for players to overcome.

They can act as the connective tissue between a region's points of interest, as barriers for progression until players have completed enough of the story, or even as housing for the most powerful Pokemon in the entire franchise. From claustrophobic cave networks to sprawling foggy forests, there's no shortage of ingenuity on display in the best dungeons the Pokemon series has to offer.

10 Reflection Cave - Pokemon X & Y

An Aesthetic Showcase of Generation 7 Charm

Like many aspects of Generation 7's Kalos region, Turnback Cave is not difficult to navigate. While many gamers can best the trainers and wild Pokemon in the dungeon relatively easily, the strength of Turnback Cave rests in its design.

As a more linear experience, Turnback Cave lends itself to a more atmospheric feel. Its mirrored surfaces not only reflect the player's image but hide trainers and entrances to the dungeon's depths. NPC trainers can even spot the reflection of players and challenge them to a battle.

9 Eterna Forest - Pokemon Diamond & Pearl

The Otherworldly Woodland You Brave With A Companion

Most dungeons in the Pokemon franchise tend to be desolate caves or majestic labyrinths. However, in connecting the player to Eterna City, Eterna Forest is a major point of interest in the Sinnoh region.

While navigating the foggy forest, players are joined by Cheryl who tasks them with aiding her to the exit. As gamers venture through the twisting trees, they will stumble across the Old Chateau and multiple ghost-type Pokemon. That's alongside one of the most memorable music tracks in the Generation 4 titles.

8 Union Cave - Pokemon Gold & Silver

Connecting Ancient Ruins With The Rest Of Johto

As players venture through the Johto region, they will naturally stumble across Union Cave. Connecting Violet City and Azalea Town, which shelter the flying and bug-type badges respectively, the dungeon also holds an ancient secret.

In Union Cave's depths, players can enter the lower levels of the Ruins of Alph which houses many of Generation II's mysteries. While it's a relatively simple cave, its central location and connection to Johto's points of interest make it one of the best dungeons in the series.

7 Kanto Power Plant - Pokemon Red & Blue

The Deteriorating Domain Of A Legendary Bird

Situated in the Generation 1 games, the Kanto Power Plant is one of the first dungeons in the entire franchise. As it has fallen into disrepair, it acts similarly to Kanto's own Pokemon Mansion. Housing many electric-type Pokemon, the Power Plant also guards a legendary secret - Zapdos.

While players can venture to the Power Plant in the Generation 2 titles, it has seen a massive overhaul and now powers the Kanto-Johto Magnet Train. Unfortunately, this commotion seems to have scared off the legendary bird.

6 Turnback Cave - Pokemon Diamond & Pearl

A Musty Maze Housing Horrifying a Legendary Presence

Turnback Cave is a dungeon accessible only to the most powerful trainers of the Sinnoh region. Players can only enter the dungeon after they have defeated the Pokemon League and - while the entrance and one other room are fixed - they must navigate a randomly generated set of rooms.

Through the thick fog of the dungeon, players can finally stumble on the dastardly figure of the legendary Renegade Pokemon Giratina.

5 Chargestone Cave - Pokemon Black & White

A Live Wire Labyrinth With Levitating Rock Puzzles

Chargestone Cave is a multi-level dungeon that players must navigate to find their way to the shelter of Mistralton City, where they can attempt the flying-type Pokemon gym challenge.

The cave network houses a special electromagnetic field that allows Pokemon such as Nosepass and Magneton to evolve, while also containing electrified rocks which have to be moved out of the way by the player before moving forward.

4 Sky Pillar - Pokemon Ruby & Sapphire

A Supernatural Spire With Collapsing Floors

While players will require a Mach Bike to navigate their way through Sky Pillar's maze of falling floor tiles, the spectacle of this Generation 3 dungeon is its greatest achievement and a temple dedicated to the Legendary Pokemon Rayquaza is an added bonus.

Players have to call on Rayquaza's aid during Pokemon Emerald's campaign to stop the cataclysmic battle between Groudon and Kyogre. This lore is expanded upon in the Generation 7 remakes of Ruby and Sapphire , to include the Draconid people who worship Rayquaza and have dedicated a mural in Sky Pillar to it.

3 Mt. Coronet - Pokemon Diamond and Pearl

The Heroic Height Housing A Labyrinthian Network

Mount Coronet is not only the tallest point in the entire Pokemon franchise, but a central point of the Sinnoh region. The dungeon has multiple levels and connects players to the rock, grass, ghost, and ice-type gym battles.

On top of this mountain range sits Spear Pillar - a focal point for the Pokemon lore and the story of the Generation 4 titles. Using the Surf and Rock Climb HMs, players can reach the top and stop Cyrus from destroying reality by freeing Dialga and Palkia.

2 The Distortion World - Pokemon Platinum

An Infernal Enigma Twisting Around The Player

In Pokemon Platinum , after players have surmised Team Galactic's plan to use Dialga and Palkia's power to destroy the universe, they must head to the top of Mount Coronet to stop them. However, gamers are ultimately too late.

Players chase after Cyrus, as he is taken by Giratina to the Distortion World. This parallel world is a labyrinth that players must navigate by solving Strength and Surf puzzles in multiple new dimensions. Trainers can eventually capture Giratina and escape back to Sinnoh, but Cyrus remains.

1 Victory Road - Pokemon Black 2 & White 2

The Ultimate End-Game Dungeon In The Franchise

The journey through Victory Road is one made by all trainers who seek to challenge the Pokemon League, regardless of region. However, Black and White 2 's Victory Road sets itself apart. The rocky caves and cliffs of the original Generation 5 games remain, with challenging trainers and rare Pokemon encounters.

However, through the in-game passage of time between the games, Victory Road went into disrepair. As remnants of that original challenge remain, with new additions, it's ultimately the greatest Victory Road in the franchise.

item.title: New Pokemon GO Change Could Get Players Banned for Playing Too Much
item.description:
Highlights

  • A new change in Pokemon GO bans players for interacting with over 160 Team GO Rocket Grunts.
  • Some fans are unhappy with the potential impact on the upcoming Pokemon GO Adventure event, where players may easily hit the limit.
  • The ban doesn't terminate the account but renders the game unplayable for a period, affecting Pokemon spawns and map visibility.

Pokemon GO fans could be in trouble for playing too much as a new change is reportedly banning players from interacting with over 160 Team GO Rocket Grunts. This change was rolled out recently and fans weren't aware of what the threshold was, but an experiment from an avid Pokemon GO player gives players the exact number of Team GO Rocket Grunts they should be careful of interacting with.

The past few weeks have been quite bittersweet for Pokemon GO fans. While the community was excited to get the rerun of the Mega Rayquaza raid in Pokemon GO , the event turned out to be a subpar experience for many players due to various issues. Amid that, it seems like users aren't happy about yet another change that will affect a highly anticipated event.

In a new post on The Silph Road subreddit, user Faladyne reveals an interesting experiment they made for the upcoming Pokemon GO Adventure Week: Taken Over event. Niantic had recently rolled out a change recently that banned users for interacting too much with the Team GO Rocket Grunts, to ensure that players don't use illegitimate ways to farm Stardust in Pokemon GO . While players were unaware of what that number was, Redditor Faladyne used a new Pokemon GO account to deliberately hit the limits. They found out that it takes 160 interactions with a Team GO Rocket Grunt member for someone to get banned. It is crucial to note that it is not necessary to battle them, and simply talking with them is enough to trigger the ban.

Pokemon GO Ban Triggered By Team GO Rocket Grunts Might Be Temporary

As far as the ban itself is concerned, it is not a permanent ban that gets the account terminated but likely seems to be a temporary cooldown for players. During this period, Pokemon will not spawn in the vicinity and players will get a blank map, rendering the game pretty much unplayable. It is not known yet how long this ban will last. Additionally, it is crucial to note that Rocket Balloons in Pokemon GO do not seem to count for this limit, so players are free to interact with them.

While a player might not hit those limits on a regular day, this discovery is of particular essence due to the upcoming Pokemon GO Adventure Week: Taken Over event. With the increased spawn rate of Team GO Rocket Grunts in the event and players hunting down specific Grunts and Pokemon, it is not quite far-fetched to hit the 160 mark. In fact, some fans noted on the post that they have managed to go way beyond the number in the past and called this change ridiculous as it is essentially banning users for playing Pokemon GO too much.

How To Get Points In Furry Scurry Monopoly GO

The milestone rewards in the Furry Scurry tournament offer 6,365 dice rolls and six sticker packs . To score points, focus on hitting your board's Railroad tiles .

Here's what tycoons will get by participating in the Bank Heist and Shutdown minigames in Furry Scurry Monopoly GO:

Shutdown

  • Blocked: Two Points
  • Successful: Four Points.

Bank Heist

  • Small: Four Points
  • Large: Six Points
  • Bankrupt: Eight Points.

item.title: New Steam Game Has Strong Stardew Valley Vibes and Very Positive Reviews
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fields of Mistria is an early access game on Steam with positive reviews, offering players a cozy farming sim experience.
  • The game features activities like fishing, mining, and romancing characters in a magical world reminiscent of Stardew Valley.
  • Expect regular updates for Fields of Mistria during its year-long early access period, with potential for even more content post 1.0 release.

A new Steam game called Fields of Mistria has just been released in early access, and it seems like the perfect pick for gamers who love farming simulators such as Stardew Valley . Fields of Mistria is the first game made by NPC Studio and currently has Very Positive reviews on Steam.

Despite the genres roots dating back to the 90s with games like Harvest Moon , farming sims have exploded in popularity during the last decade with the release of Stardew Valley . This has led to the emergence of dozens of excellent farming sims on Steam every year.

Now, Fields of Mistria has been released in early access on Steam, and it currently has 97% positive reviews. Set in the idyllic village of Mistria, the new game allows players to explore a small town with over 30 villagers, plant over 50 types of crops during different seasons, explore a magical world, and romance 12 characters. Fields of Mistria has activities such as fishing, mining, crafting items, raising different animals, and even unlockable magical skills that will make farming easier. At the moment, however, the game is not entirely complete. Romances, for example, are still incomplete, and will only go to 4 out of 10 hearts, with more content to be added later.

Fields of Mistria Has Strong Stardew Valley Vibes

Unfortunately, Fields of Mistria does not have an official release date for its 1.0 version. However, the games official Steam page indicates that the title is planned to be in early access for around a year and that it will receive regular content updates during this time. If the early impressions of the Steam players are anything to go by, though, Fields of Mistria could eventually be an amazing indie farming sim after its 1.0 release.

Fields of Mistria is the latest of many farming simulator games to be available on Steam. Earlier this year, for example, Everafter Falls was released on Steam. In Everafter Falls , gamers can explore another idyllic world, but the title has a sci-fi twist, as players start the story by waking up and discovering that their characters previous life was only a simulation, and have to explore the real world.

The PC gaming market is full of Stardew Valley -inspired games these days, and one of the most noteworthy ones is the upcoming Mirthwood , which will be out on September 11. Mirthwood promises classic farming sim tropes such as taking care of a farm, but will mix them with RPG elements and exploration in a fantasy world.

item.title: Stardew Valley Player Shares Embarrassing Fence Mistake
item.description:
Highlights

  • Avoid getting stuck in a Stardew Valley fence by always having a gate on hand for a quick escape route.
  • Even embarrassing moments in the game can be a learning experience for players to be more prepared.
  • While mistakes can happen to anyone, Stardew Valley's mechanics help prevent serious consequences.

A Stardew Valley player has shared an embarassing moment that they experienced while building a fence on their farm. While the player says they feel foolish about it, it's a good teaching moment for fans of Stardew Valley to be aware of what they have available to them when building fences.

Stardew Valley players are allowed to decorate their farms as they see fit. Fans can build perfect Stardew Valley farms with every single corner set up just as they like it, or they can stick to minimalistic and functional decorations and barriers. In either case, though, this could be a mistake waiting to happen to anyone.

Stardew Valley fan witherwingg shared their embarrassment at getting stuck inside their own fence on their farm. A screenshot shows the player's farmer standing in the middle of a fenced-in area, still holding an additional Wood Fence post over their head. The player had previously given their axe away to Clint to upgrade the Stardew Valley tool, which requires leaving it behind for a couple days while it's worked on. Without thinking about it, they started building a fence and enclosed it, forgetting that they had no way to break down the fence and escape once they were inside. The only option for them at that point was to give up and wait for their farmer to pass out, or restart the day entirely.

Bypassing Getting Trapped Within a Stardew Valley Fence

Fellow players were sympathetic to the fan's plight. Some were quick to point out that there is a potential solution to this problem for anyone who finds themselves in a similar circumstance. If a player has a gate in their inventory or can craft one, they can set down the gate where the fence already is and it will replace the nearby fence posts with the gate, giving them an escape route. However, this particular fan says they had no Wood in their inventory, so this wasn't an option for them either.

Thankfully, the game's daily saves and its exhaustion system help to prevent mistakes from having more serious outcomes. While there is a negative impact the following day if the farmer is awake past 2 am and doesn't make it to bed, it's a relatively minor thing and can be compensated for with food or resting during the day in the Stardew Valley spa or bed in single-player and multiplayer modes, respectively. Even so, it's easy to understand why the player felt foolish in that moment.

For what it's worth, witherwingg is far from the first fan to have an embarrassing moment in Stardew Valley . Mistakes can happen to anyone, after all, but hopefully witherwingg's experience will help to keep fellow fans from finding themselves trapped the same way.
